Function Documentation

int ReadRawData ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
WORD *  Data,
int  Size,
int *  NumRead 
)

Like ReadScaledData(), except that data collected are unscaled analog-to-digital board counts. Data buffer to be filled is array of WORDs instead of doubles, as WORD will accommodate 16-bit resolution; the highest the BioRadio supports. Regardless of whether ReadScaledData(), ReadRawData(), ReadScaledFastAndSlowData(), or ReadRawFastAndSlowData() is called, the background buffers will be cleared; subsequent calls to either function will gather only new data since last request. Acquisition must be started. Must be preceded by TransferBuffer().

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Databuffer for acquired data
Sizecardinality of Data array; should be equal to (or greater than) the value returned by most recent call to TransferBuffer()
NumReadnumber of samples returned and filled in Data array
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int ReadRawFastAndSlowData ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
WORD *  FastInputsData,
int  FastInputsSize,
int *  FastInputsNumRead,
WORD *  SlowInputsData,
int  SlowInputsSize,
int *  SlowInputsNumRead 
)

Like ReadScaledFastAndSlowData(), except that data collected are unscaled analog-to-digital board counts. See also ReadRawData(). Acquisition must be started. Must be preceded by TransferBuffer().

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
FastInputsDatabuffer for acquired data
FastInputsSizecardinality of FastInputsData array; should be equal to (or greater than) the value returned by most recent call to TransferBuffer()
FastInputsNumReadnumber of samples returned and filled in FastInputsData array
SlowInputsDatabuffer for acquired data
SlowInputsSizecardinality of SlowInputsData array; should be ((FastInputsSize/NumFastInputs)*NumSlowInputs)/10
SlowInputsNumReadnumber of samples returned and filled in SlowInputsData array
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int ReadScaledData ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
double *  Data,
int  Size,
int *  NumRead 
)

Move recently acquired scaled data, interleaved by Input, from background buffer to application buffer. Regardless of whether ReadScaledData(), ReadRawData(), ReadScaledFastAndSlowData(), or ReadRawFastAndSlowData() is called, the background buffers will be cleared; subsequent calls to either function will gather only new data since last request. Acquisition must be started. Must be preceded by TransferBuffer().

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Databuffer for acquired data
Sizecardinality of Data array; should be equal to (or greater than) the value returned by most recent call to TransferBuffer()
NumReadnumber of samples returned and filled in Data array
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int ReadScaledFastAndSlowData ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
double *  FastInputsData,
int  FastInputsSize,
int *  FastInputsNumRead,
WORD *  SlowInputsData,
int  SlowInputsSize,
int *  SlowInputsNumRead 
)

Like ReadScaledData(), but, in addition to reading scaled data from fast inputs, read data from slow inputs in the same manner. Slow inputs are sampled at 1/10 the rate of fast inputs. Acquisition must be started. Must be preceded by TransferBuffer().

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
FastInputsDatabuffer for acquired data
FastInputsSizecardinality of FastInputsData array; should be equal to (or greater than) the value returned by most recent call to TransferBuffer()
FastInputsNumReadnumber of samples returned and filled in FastInputsData array
SlowInputsDatabuffer for acquired data
SlowInputsSizecardinality of SlowInputsData array; should be equal to (or greater than) ((FastInputsSize/NumFastInputs)*NumSlowInputs)/10
SlowInputsNumReadnumber of samples returned and filled in SlowInputsData array
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)
int SetBadDataValues ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
double  BadDataValueScaled,
WORD  BadDataValueRaw 
)

Set the values with which the data stream is padded when data is lost in transmission.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
BadDataValueScaledValue for padding scaled data. Range:[-MAXFLOAT,MAXFLOAT] (default: -MAXFLOAT)
BadDataValueRawValue for padding raw (unscaled) data. Range:[0,65535] (default: 65535)
Returns:
success (1) or no device object at handle (-1)
int SetPadWait ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
int  numMissingPackets 
)

Set the number of expected (but not received) packets the acquisition routine should wait before beginning to insert padded (BadDataValue) data into the stream.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
numMissingPacketsnumber of packets to wait; a packet includes 10 sweeps of enabled fast inputs, and one sweep of enabled slow inputs
int TransferBuffer ( DWORD  BioRadio150 )

Prepare the data buffers for a call to ReadScaledData(), ReadRawData(), ReadScaledFastAndSlowData(), or ReadRawFastAndSlowData(). Acquisition must be started.

Parameters:
BioRadio150object handle
Returns:
number of samples collected (and ready to be read) over all fast inputs, or no device object at handle (-1)
